alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Eastern Lincoln County; Southwest Chaves County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 4:44PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN LINCOLN AND SOUTHWESTERN CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 444 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles northeast of Elk, or 25 miles northeast of Mayhill, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Lincoln and southwestern Chaves Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for southeastern New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Eastern Lincoln County; Southwest Chaves County
